org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Petition of A. C. Hallam for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Now comes E. H. Bowdoin, Mayor and ex-officio Chief of polic of the City of Bremerton, and in answer to writ of habeas corpus shows the court as follows:

Answering paragraph Two (2) of said petition, this respondent admits that the Navy Yard Hotel is located on Government property, and is owned by the U. S. Government, and admits that employees of the Puget Sound Navy Yard reside at said hotel, but denies that it is used exclusively for employees of the Navy Yard, but affirmatively alleges that said Hotel may be used by anyone.

Answering paragraph Three (3) of said petition, respondent on information, denies that the said A. C. Hallam is an agent of the United States, or is managing said hotel on behalf of the Navy Department.
Answering Paragraphs Four (4), Five (5) and Six (6), of said petition, respondent admits the same.
Answering Paragraph Seven (7) respondent denies the same.
By way of affirmative defense, in answer to said writ, respondent shows this Honorable court, as follows:
That the Hotel in question is situated within the corporate limits of the City of Bremerton, and is not situated within the boundary of the Puget Sound Navy Yard.

That the property on which said hotel is situated consisted of two separate tracts of land divided by street in Bremerton; that in the year 1917 or 1918, the City vacated said street at the request of the Government; that subsequently to said vacation, the United States Housing Corporation or the Navy Department, the respondent at this time not knowing which, built said hotel.

That subsequently to its being built, respondent believes and on information alleges the fact to be, that said Hotel has been leased by the Navy Department to different parties, and is now leased to A. C. Hallam.
That on said property and in said Hotel are operated, a laundry, restaurant, cafeteria, pool room, bakery, dance hall etc. all being open to the public, and advertised in the Bremerton newspapers.

That said Hotel is leased by the said A.C.Hallam from the Government or the Navy Department, in the same manner as it would be leased from a private party, and is operated by the said A.C.Hallam in the same manner
as any other hotel is operated, so far as espondent can observe.
That said hotel, the same as all other hotels in Bremerton, is patronized by the Navy Yard Employees, as well as others who come to Bremerton.
WHEREFORE espondent prays that said petition for writ and said writ be discharged and denied.
Mayor and ex-offico Chief of Police of Bremerton.

E.H.Bowdoin being first duly sworn on oath says; that he is the Mayor of Bremerton and as mayor is ex officio Chief of Police, that he has heard read the foregoing Answer, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 22nd day of Jan. 1921.
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Bremerton.
In the Matter of the Petition of A.C.Hallam, for writ of Habeas Corpus.
Filed in the United States District Court
